skill.name: aeon
skill.description: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regression, clustering, forecasting, anomaly detection, segmentation, and similarity search. Use when working with temporal data, sequential patterns, or time-indexed observations requiring specialized algorithms beyond standard ML approaches. Particularly suited for univariate and multivariate time series analysis with scikit-learn compatible APIs.
skill.summary: This skill should be used for time series machine learning tasks including classification, regressio...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with Python code examples. No executable scripts, network calls, file system access, or external commands detected. All 523 static findings are false positives triggered by markdown formatting (backticks for inline code), documentation links, and library references. This is a wrapper for the legitimate aeon Python machine learning toolkit.

content.value_statement: Time series data requires specialized algorithms for classification, forecasting, and anomaly detection. Aeon provides a scikit-learn compatible toolkit with state-of-the-art algorithms for temporal data analysis.
actual_capabilities: Classify time series into categories using ROCKET, DTW, and deep learning classifiers
Forecast future values with ARIMA, exponential smoothing, and TCN networks
Detect anomalies and outliers using matrix profiles and statistical methods
Cluster similar time series patterns with DTW-aware algorithms
Find repeated patterns and motifs through similarity search
Segment time series at change points and regime boundaries
limitations: Requires the aeon library to be installed separately via pip
Does not include data preprocessing beyond normalization and imputation
Does not provide visualization or plotting functionality
Does not include built-in data collection or API integration

use_cases.title: Analyze sensor data
use_cases.description: Build classification models for IoT sensor streams and detect equipment failures.

use_cases.title: Study temporal patterns
use_cases.description: Discover motifs and anomalies in scientific measurement data with specialized distance metrics.

use_cases.title: Forecast metrics
use_cases.description: Predict sales, demand, or website traffic using ARIMA and neural forecasting models.

prompt_templates.title: Quick classification
prompt_templates.prompt: Use aeon to classify this time series data. Install aeon, then load the data and train a MiniRocketClassifier for fast baseline performance.

prompt_templates.title: Anomaly detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Detect anomalies in this time series using aeon. Use the STOMP algorithm to compute anomaly scores and identify points exceeding the 95th percentile.

prompt_templates.title: Forecasting
prompt_templates.prompt: Forecast future values from this time series using aeon. Use ARIMA or TCNForecaster to predict the next 7 time steps.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern discovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recurring patterns in this time series using aeon. Use StompMotif to discover the top 3 motifs and report their positions.

output_examples.input: Use aeon to classify the GunPoint dataset
output: Installed aeon and loaded GunPoint training/test splits
Achieved classification accuracy on test set
Pipeline ready for new time series classification

output_examples.input: Detect anomalies in my server metrics data
output: Loaded time series with 10000 data points
Applied STOMP anomaly detector with window size 50
Flagged periods of unusual activity for review
Fitted ARIMA(1,1,1) model on historical sales
Model captures trend and seasonality patterns

best_practices: Normalize data before applying most algorithms to improve performance and convergence
Start with fast methods like MiniRocket before moving to deep learning approaches
Use DTW distance with window constraints to limit computational cost
Validate results using cross-validation when training data is limited
anti_patterns: Using deep learning classifiers on small datasets without sufficient samples
Skipping data normalization when using elastic distance metrics like DTW
Applying DTW without window constraints on long time series causing slow computation
Using lock-step distances when temporal warping and phase shifts are expected

faq.question: Is aeon compatible with scikit-learn?
faq.answer: Yes, aeon estimators follow scikit-learn fit/predict API and work with sklearn pipelines.

faq.question: What data formats does aeon support?
faq.answer: Aeon accepts numpy arrays with shape (n_samples, n_channels, n_timepoints).

faq.question: Can I use aeon for multivariate time series?
faq.answer: Yes, most algorithms handle multiple channels and multivariate series natively.

faq.question: How do I install aeon?
faq.answer: Run 'uv pip install aeon' or 'pip install aeon' in your environment.

faq.question: What is the difference between DTW and Euclidean distance?
faq.answer: DTW allows temporal warping while Euclidean compares point-by-point fixed alignment.

faq.question: When should I use deep learning vs classical methods?
faq.answer: Start with classical methods like MiniRocket for speed. Use deep learning for large datasets.
